result.execSummary:
The defendant William O. Oakley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William O. Oakley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William O. Oakley was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William O. Oakley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Brandi, ONSO Dispatch, notified to cancel warrants.  Fine and restitution paid in full.  Per Judge O'Melia - cancel body only warrant as restitution has been paid.  Unable to enter WCCC event/Dispo Warrant - Error message of "This party has too many active warrant.  Please use the warrant application to dispose of warrant.
03:13 pm - Defendant William O. Oakley not in court.  Defendant owes $1,000.00.  Court authorizes warrant.
Two Character Reference letters from victim

02:50 pm - Defendant William O. Oakley in court with attorney John J Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss counts 2 through 4 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  State files Victim Impact Statement.  Michlig/Hogan/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Fine $1000.00
Restitution $643.44
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

02:21 pm - Defendant William O. Oakley in court with attorney John J Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hogan states rec'd proposal this past Friday - requests adjournment to review with defendant.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

03:018 pm - Defendant William O. Oakley in court with attorney John J Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michlig states met with Hogan working towards final resolution now that divorce is finalized.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Defendant William O. Oakley in court with attorney John J Hogan.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:30
State calls Deputy Brian Wege/sworn/direct/Cross by Hogan - 
Hogan statement/Michlig statement - Court statement - Court finds probable cause exists and binds over- Hogan waives presentation of information based on State's assertion that the information will mirror complaint  and be filed shortly - will enter not guilty plea at this time 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

02:40 pm - Defendant William O. Oakley in court with attorney John J. Hogan.  Susan J. Sommer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 11:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for William O. Oakley
Current: 707 Cheryl Ave, Tomahawk, WI 54487 United States  (Effective: 04-01-2014)
Prior: 9922 Swamp Lake Road, Tomahawk, WI 54487

1:16 p.m. Defendant William O. Oakley in court, in custody, via video with attorney John J. Hogan, as a courtesy. Defendant will need to retain counsel Hogan. Steven M. Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in receipt of complaint; Atty. Hogan waives reading of the complaint;  Michlig/Hogan statement to bond. Court orders $3,500 sig. bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
